sentence: But theres so much I could have done. I was a director in my 20s who who came from nothing and was suddenly on the cover of fucking time out New York. I didnt even want to get married, *** it. Theres so much I didnt do.
Opinion: felt regret and frustration over missed opportunities and relationship issues
Rationale: Because he reflects on the things he could have done but didnt, feeling regret and frustration over missed opportunities and relationship conflicts, he expressed dissatisfaction with his life choices.

sentence: Thanks for that.
Rationale: Because its not clear whether the second speaker is genuinely grateful or sarcastic, the context is not enough to determine the true emotional state, so the emotion is ambiguous.

sentence: Youre welcome.
Rationale: Because this is a common polite response, without any emotional color, just a normal polite interaction.

sentence: I cant believe I had to know you forever.
Rationale: Because he seems to be complaining about having to know the first speaker for a long time, indicating that this relationship brings him inconvenience or annoyance, so he has a negative emotional expression.

sentence: Youre f**king crazy.
Rationale: Because the first speaker thinks the other partys words or behavior are unreasonable or excessive, so he uses swear words to express his anger and dissatisfaction, which is a negative emotional expression.
